information:
The Democratic primary for Attorney General of Virginia on June 17, 2025, features two candidates: Jay Jones and Shannon Taylor. Jones is a former Norfolk state delegate and assistant attorney general with previous statewide campaign experience from a 2021 run for the same office. His platform includes a focus on consumer protection, civil rights, and labor justice. Taylor has served as the Henrico County Commonwealth's Attorney for over 11 years, emphasizing her background in law enforcement and prosecution. Both candidates have publicly stated their opposition to policies of the Trump administration.

As of early May 2025, campaign finance reports indicated that Jay Jones held a significant fundraising advantage. He had raised approximately $1.8 million, with $1.4 million in cash on hand. In contrast, reports for Shannon Taylor showed she had raised over $1 million. Earlier reports from the first quarter of the year indicated Jones had a roughly 2-to-1 fundraising lead over Taylor, having raised approximately $900,000 to her $525,000.

Jay Jones has secured endorsements from several high-profile Virginia Democrats, including former Governors Terry McAuliffe and Ralph Northam, as well as U.S. Representative Bobby Scott. Shannon Taylor's endorsements include support from the Fairfax County Commonwealth's Attorney and some former attorneys general. The winner of the primary will face the incumbent Republican, Jason Miyares, in the general election.

forecast.status_quo_outcome: Jerrauld "Jay" Jones will win the Democratic primary. His significant advantages in fundraising and high-profile endorsements from key figures in the Virginia Democratic party position him as the clear frontrunner.
forecast.no_outcome_scenario: Shannon Taylor wins the primary. Her message as a long-serving and experienced county prosecutor resonates more strongly with primary voters, particularly moderates concerned with public safety. A superior get-out-the-vote operation in her home base of Henrico County and other key localities, potentially combined with a late gaffe from the Jones campaign, allows her to overcome his financial disadvantage and secure the nomination.
forecast.yes_outcome_scenario: Jerrauld "Jay" Jones wins the primary. His substantial fundraising advantage allows his campaign to dominate the airwaves and digital advertising in the final two weeks. The endorsements from former governors McAuliffe and Northam prove decisive in consolidating party support, and his previous statewide campaign experience translates into a more effective voter turnout operation, leading to a comfortable victory.
forecast.rationale:
My forecast is based primarily on Jay Jones's commanding position in two key areas for primary elections: fundraising and endorsements. As of early May, Jones had a significant cash-on-hand advantage ($1.4 million to Taylor's roughly $1 million), which is crucial for funding advertising and get-out-the-vote (GOTV) efforts in the critical final weeks. Furthermore, Jones has secured endorsements from major Virginia Democratic figures, including two former governors, Terry McAuliffe and Ralph Northam, and Congressman Bobby Scott. These endorsements act as powerful signals to party loyalists and undecided voters. His prior experience running statewide in 2021, while unsuccessful, provided him with valuable name recognition and a campaign infrastructure that he is leveraging effectively. The status quo suggests that these structural advantages are too significant for his opponent to overcome in the remaining time.

My probability is not higher than 75% because Shannon Taylor remains a credible and strong candidate. Her 11-year tenure as the Henrico County Commonwealth's Attorney provides a compelling resume, especially for voters who prioritize prosecutorial experience. In a lower-turnout primary, a motivated base of support in her home territory could make the race closer than expected. An unforeseen event or a particularly strong performance in the final stretch could still shift the dynamics in her favor.

My probability is not lower than 75% because Jones's advantages are multi-faceted and difficult to surmount. The combination of financial superiority, backing from the party establishment, and existing name ID from a previous run makes him a formidable frontrunner. It would require a major polling error or a significant political event to derail a campaign with such a strong foundation so close to election day.

I would increase my forecast if late polling showed Jones with a consistent double-digit lead or if he secured another major endorsement. I would decrease my forecast if Taylor reported a last-minute fundraising surge, a major news outlet endorsed Taylor, or a significant negative story about Jones emerged.

prompt:
You are a professional forecaster interviewing for a job.

Your interview question is:
Will Jerrauld "Jay" Jones win the Democratic primary for attorney general of Virginia in the 2025 election?

Question background:
Washington Post: [Former Del. Jay Jones (D) of Norfolk ramps up bid for Virginia AG](https://www.washingtonpost.com/dc-md-va/2024/11/12/virginia-jones-miyares-ag-election/)


This question's outcome will be determined by the specific criteria below. These criteria have not yet been satisfied:
This question resolves as **Yes** if [Jerrauld "Jay" Jones](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jay_Jones_(politician)) wins the 2025 Democratic primary for Attorney General of Virginia, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions).

The Democratic primary election is currently scheduled for June 17, 2025. If there is no Democratic primary held before June 30, 2025, the question will be **annulled**.


Your research assistant's report says:
The Democratic primary for Attorney General of Virginia on June 17, 2025, features two candidates: Jay Jones and Shannon Taylor. Jones is a former Norfolk state delegate and assistant attorney general with previous statewide campaign experience from a 2021 run for the same office. His platform includes a focus on consumer protection, civil rights, and labor justice. Taylor has served as the Henrico County Commonwealth's Attorney for over 11 years, emphasizing her background in law enforcement and prosecution. Both candidates have publicly stated their opposition to policies of the Trump administration.

As of early May 2025, campaign finance reports indicated that Jay Jones held a significant fundraising advantage. He had raised approximately $1.8 million, with $1.4 million in cash on hand. In contrast, reports for Shannon Taylor showed she had raised over $1 million. Earlier reports from the first quarter of the year indicated Jones had a roughly 2-to-1 fundraising lead over Taylor, having raised approximately $900,000 to her $525,000.

Jay Jones has secured endorsements from several high-profile Virginia Democrats, including former Governors Terry McAuliffe and Ralph Northam, as well as U.S. Representative Bobby Scott. Shannon Taylor's endorsements include support from the Fairfax County Commonwealth's Attorney and some former attorneys general. The winner of the primary will face the incumbent Republican, Jason Miyares, in the general election.

Today is 2025-06-03.

Before answering you think:
(a) The time left until the outcome to the question is known.
(b) The status quo outcome if nothing changed.
(c) A brief description of a scenario that results in a No outcome.
(d) A brief description of a scenario that results in a Yes outcome.
(e) You write your rationale remembering that good forecasters put extra weight on the status quo outcome since the world changes slowly most of the time. Explain your reasoning and the evidence behind your forecast in detail. Summarise information your received from your research assistant that influences your forecast (if any). Explain why your forecast is not higher, and why it is not lower. Outline what would need to be true for you to update your forecast in either direction.
(f) The last thing you write is your final probabilistic forecast as a number between 0 and 100.

# OUTPUT SCHEMA
{
    "time_left_until_outcome_known": "string",
    "status_quo_outcome": "string",
    "no_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "yes_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "rationale": "string",
    "probability": "number" (0-100)
}
